intro: Cirsium boluense, commonly known as the Bolu thistle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It is a perennial species that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
